Key Match Events: Edwards launched himself over the Magic's Anthony Black for a dunk, then came down with a glare at the crowd to give the Wolves a 10-point lead with 3:19 left in the third quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: The lack of scoring punch continues to be a problem for the Magic, which shot 38% and is now the lowest-scoring team in the NBA at 104.8 points per game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves broke a seven-game losing streak against Eastern Conference opponents.
In the middle of the fourth quarter the Timberwolves were 12 for 28 (43%) from 3-point range while the Magic were 6 for 30 (20%).
Others: The 22-year-old power forward, out since October with a torn right oblique, is expected to return Friday night.
The Timberwolves host Memphis on Saturday night. The Magic host Milwaukee on Friday night.
